metadata.title: CVE-2024-36956 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal/debugfs: Free all thermal zone debug memory on zone removal Becausethermal_debug_tz_remove() does not free all memory allocated for thermalzone diagnostics, some of that memory becomes unreachable after freeing thethermal zone's struct thermal_debugfs object. Address this by makingthermal_debug_tz_remove() free all of the memory in question. Cc :6.8+<stable@vger.kernel.org> # 6.8+

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
